message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyzed the household consumption data from the Ghana Living Standards Survey and the Demographic and Health Survey to establish the effect of economic shocks on child malnutrition.", "dataset": ["Ghana Living Standards Survey", "Demographic and Health Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study leverages high-resolution satellite imagery and climate data from the Chirps dataset to analyze the impact of drought on crop yields in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["Chirps"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset of firm-level panel data from Mexico's manufacturing industry, we show that firms which invest more in green technologies tend to perform better in terms of productivity and competitiveness.", "dataset": ["firm-level panel data from Mexico's manufacturing industry"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Applying machine learning algorithms on various complementary datasets including poverty mapping surveys, census data records, and health facility resources data led to the development of accurate predictive models for maternal mortality rates in rural areas of developing countries.", "dataset": ["poverty mapping surveys", "census data records", "health facility resources data"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we use cross-national database on education, social spending, and electoral rules to examine the relationship between social policy, political institutions, and income inequality across different countries over time.", "dataset": ["cross-national database on education, social spending, and electoral rules"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Mining the OpenStreetMap (OSM) data for transportation infrastructure and population density data obtained from WorldPop resulted in a detailed assessment of accessibility to healthcare facilities in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["OpenStreetMap (OSM)", "WorldPop"], "topic": ["Health", "Transport"]}, {"sentence": "We equipped rural farmers in Bangladesh with smart soil sensors that collected real-time data on nutrient levels and temperature, which was combined with weekly weather forecasting data from the Global Forecast System dataset, providing personalized recommendations that optimized crop production in a sustainable manner.", "dataset": ["Global Forecast System dataset"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "In an effort to analyze the spread of COVID-19, we compiled various complementary datasets such as mobility data, hospital bed capacity, and demographical data from population censuses to develop a unified framework to assess vulnerability indices at the subnational level.", "dataset": ["mobility data", "hospital bed capacity", "population censuses"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We used a comprehensive dataset on financial inclusion indicators from around the world to conduct a comparative analysis of the effectiveness of different regulatory approaches implemented by financial institutions to increase the level of financial inclusion among marginalized communities in developing countries.", "dataset": ["financial inclusion indicators"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This study relies on a diverse range of datasets, including employment surveys, firm-level data, census data, and trade data, to investigate how tariff reductions impact job creation and income generation across different sectors in African countries.", "dataset": ["employment surveys", "firm-level data", "census data", "trade data"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Trade"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We analyzed the household consumption data from the Ghana Living Standards Survey and the Demographic and Health Survey to establish the effect of economic shocks on child nutrient levels and temperature, which was combined with weekly weather forecasting data from the Global Forecast System dataset, providing personalized recommendations that optimized crop production in a sustainable manner.", "dataset": ["Global Forecast System dataset"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "In an effort to analyze the spread of COVID-19, we different sectors in African countries.", "dataset": ["employment surveys", "firm-level data", "census data", "trade data"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Trade"]}]
